title: ‘It’s an emergency’: Homelessness on the rise in Hong Kong
description: In one of the world’s most expensive cities, the number of people without a home to call their own is soaring.

title: Veteran US Senator Dianne Feinstein will not seek re-election
description: California's Feinstein, 89, says she intends to finish her term as several Democrats eye her open seat in 2024.

title: Colombians take to the streets in favour of healthcare reforms
description: Proposed reforms aim to expand healthcare access as part of President Gustavo Petro's agenda on poverty and inequality.

title: Argentinians drown in spiralling inflation at nearly 100%
description: The South American country, which has battled soaring prices for years, saw its annual inflation hit 98.8 percent.

title: US arrests four suspects linked to assassination of Haiti’s Moise
description: Officials say, while ex-President Jovenel Moise was killed in Port-au-Prince, plot against him was mostly planned in US.

title: Russia prepares ‘air fight’ as Ukraine ground war grinds on
description: NATO officials push for the quick procurement of air defences for Ukraine as Russia eyes the skies for battlefield edge.

title: Ukraine confronts two enemies: Russia and corruption
description: While the US, EU and NATO have pledged to continue supporting Ukraine, worries remain over corruption in the country.

title: Will more women be elected for senior political roles in Nigeria?
description: Voters head to the polls on February 25 with a woman running for the presidency and others for state and national posts.

title: US says first missile missed unidentified aerial object on Sunday
description: US General Mark Milley says that difficult terrain has hampered efforts to recover debris from latest downed objects.

title: Earthquake aid reaches NW Syria via newly opened crossing
description: Ten IOM trucks carrying humanitarian assistance passed through the Bab al-Salam crossing, UN spokesman says.

title: China’s Xi conveys support for Iran during Raisi’s visit
description: Xi said China will continue to 'participate constructively' in talks to resume negotiations on Iran nuclear agreement.

title: ‘Strongly opposed’: European powers denounce Israel settlements
description: Ministers from UK, France, Germany, and Italy oppose the plan, saying it will increase tensions with the Palestinians.

title: Michigan governor calls for action after university shooting
description: Gretchen Whitmer decries 'uniquely American' problem of mass shootings as police identify suspect who killed three.

title: US inflation slows to 6.4% but price pressures remain
description: Govt's consumer price report shows inflationary pressures remain stubborn and are likely to fuel price spikes this year.

title: NATO chief hints Finland, Sweden could join alliance separately
description: Jens Stoltenberg says Nordic nations becoming members together is not top priority as Turkey continues to block Sweden.

title: Volunteer groups rush to distribute aid to Turkey quake victims
description: Ad hoc aid operations have been set up by ordinary citizens across Turkey in the wake of the catastrophic earthquakes.

title: Bus and armoured truck collision kills 20 in South Africa
description: At least 60 others were injured in the incident that happened on Monday in South Africa's northern Limpopo province.

title: Israel’s home demolitions a ‘war on nerves’ for Palestinians
description: East Jerusalem residents know that suspended demolition orders remain in force and may be executed at any moment.

title: Former US envoy to UN Nikki Haley announces 2024 presidential bid
description: Haley is the second Republican after former President Donald Trump to announce bid to becomes party's candidate.

title: Ford to slash thousands of Europe jobs as it eyes electric future
description: US carmaker says job losses over next three years will include some 2,300 positions in Germany and 1,300 in the UK.

title: The dogs helping find earthquake survivors in Turkey
description: Trained rescue dogs are helping to find survivors buried underneath layers of concrete and otherwise undetectable.

title: Analysis: Scars of annulled 1993 vote trail Nigeria 2023 election
description: Parallels are being drawn between the 2023 poll and the annulled 1993 vote, seen as the country’s ‘freest and fairest'.

title: Two Palestinians killed in latest Israeli raids in West Bank
description: Israel has killed 50 Palestinians, including 11 children, in the 45 days since 2023 began.

title: 400 love letters and a play: How two Indian prisoners found love
description: A former forest bandit and a trafficking survivor found love - and purpose - while serving life sentences in prison.

title: The unmistakable musk of feudalism
description: Elon Musk running Twitter as if it is his personal fiefdom is a sign of the emergence of a new form of feudalism.

title: Photos: Valentine’s Day celebrations around the world
description: The February 14 occasion is marked in many countries but traditions are often very different.

title: Russians who fled war win case to end stay at South Korea airport
description: Two of five Russians living for months at Incheon airport to avoid fighting in Ukraine have refugee appeal accepted.

title: Indian tax agents raid BBC offices in wake of Modi documentary
description: Raids come after Indian government sought to block BBC documentary critical of Modi's role in 2022 anti-Muslim riots.

title: ‘Its so cold’: Earthquake aid eludes many in southeastern Turkey
description: Residents of Osmaniye say they need food and proper housing arrangements to take care of their children.

title: Syria White Helmets criticise UN over Assad say on aid deliveries
description: The rescue group in northwest Syria has criticised the UN stance on aid delivery in the aftermath of the earthquake.

title: Equatorial Guinea confirms first Marburg virus disease outbreak
description: Nine deaths from the disease linked to a funeral ceremony in Equatorial Guinea's Kie-Ntem province bordering Cameroon.

title: New Zealand declares emergency as Cyclone Gabrielle eases
description: New Zealand declares state of emergency after Cyclone Gabrielle lashes the country’s North Island.

title: Australia warns of foreign surveillance operations, names Iran
description: Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil says intelligence agency shut down an Iranian operation targeting a dual citizen.

title: Tunisia arrests more prominent critics of President Saied
description: Detentions come amid a wave of arrests targeting politicians and other critics of the government.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 356
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 356th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Michigan university: Gunman kills three before killing himself
description: Gunman opened fire in an academic building and student union on Monday night, police say.

title: Modi ally says BJP has ‘nothing to hide’ amid Adani controversy
description: India's home minister Amit Shah makes comments after ruling party accused of favouritism towards embattled conglomerate.

title: Myanmar’s military regime to let ‘loyal’ citizens carry weapons
description: Gun owners will have to comply if ordered to take part in 'security, law enforcement, and stability' operations.

title: Indonesia’s ‘Trial of the Century’ ends in death sentence
description: The murder trial of former two-star police general Ferdy Sambo has exposed the force to rare public scrutiny.

title: Japan names university academic as next central bank governor
description: Economics professor Kazuo Ueda's nomination comes after outgoing governor's deputy reportedly turned down the role.

title: How India’s attempt to block BBC documentary on Modi backfired
description: Govt efforts to ban the BBC documentary drew more attention to it and showed the inefficacy of such measures.

title: US says Beijing’s South China Sea laser use ‘provocative, unsafe’
description: Washington stresses it stands by Manila after a laser was directed at a Philippine Coast Guard ship near a shoal.

title: Japan’s economy rebounds less than expected amid COVID recovery
description: Asia’s second-largest economy grows 0.2 percent during the October-December period, falling short of expectations.

title: US President fires Capitol appointee amid January 6 criticism
description: J Brett Blanton, Architect of the Capitol, has been accused of abusing his authority and misusing government property.

title: US condemns Nicaragua’s imprisonment of outspoken bishop
description: Bishop Roland Alvarez was sentenced to 26 years in prison after refusing to join other political prisoners in exile.

title: New Zealand declares rare national emergency after massive storm
description: Torrential rain and high tides from Cyclone Gabrielle lead to severe flooding and landslides, cutting power.

title: Twitter’s plan to charge for crucial tool to hit disaster relief
description: Software developers use a crucial Twitter tool to comb the platform for calls for help and connect with rescue orgs.
